msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Part b
msItem.explicit: ܘܐܢ ܬܘܒ ܐܝܬ ܕܣ̣ܢܐ ܣܓܝ. ܗܐ ܛܘܦܣܗ ܒܐܣܩܪܝܘܛܐ
msItem.note: This was originally the seventh discourse in the volume, as appears from the letter ܚ at the commencement of the next.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: On scarcity of rain
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܕܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ̣. ܘܥܠ ܒܨܝܪܘܬ ܡܛܪܐ
msItem.incipit: ܨܗܐ ܗܘ ܓܝܪ ܪܘܡܗ̇ ܕܫܡܝܐ. ܠܒܟܬܗ̇ ܕܬܝܒܘܬܢ: ܐܝܟ ܕܨܗܐ ܥܘܡܩܐ ܕܐܪܥܐ. ܠܛܠܐ ܘܡܛܪܐ ܕܥ̈ܢܢܐ: ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: On the same subject
msItem.incipit: ܦܐܪܐ ܕܕܡ̇ܐ ܠܝܠܘܕܗ. ܐܬܪܚܡ ܥܠ ܛܠܘ̈ܡܐ: ܚܘܢ ܡܪܝ ܒܝ̣̈ܫܐ ܒܙܩܝܦܟ. ܘܠܬܝ̈ܒܐ ܒܨܠܝܒܟ: ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Part e
msItem.incipit: ܪܒܝܥܐ ܕܡܛܪܐ ܒܦܘܩܕܢܟ. ܡܣܚܐ ܠܐܪܥܐ ܘܡܕܗܢ ܠܗ̇: ܘ܏ܫ

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: On the poor man and the rich man (Lazarus and Dives)
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 223, no. 23.
This was originally the 17th discourse (ܝܙ) in the volume.

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: On repentance
msItem.note: See Assem., p. 225, no. 40, serm. i.

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: On the perfection of the brethren

item.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 87 leaves, some of which are slightly torn and soiled, especially foll. 1—15, 54 and 55. The quires, signed with letters and arithmetical figures (fol. 71 b, ܝܒ ��), must have been at least 15 in number; but several of them are lost, and others are imperfect, leaves being wanting at the beginning and end, as well as after foll. 2, 10, 11, 15, 47, 54, 61, 71, and 79. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 20 to 35 lines. Foll. 16—46 are palimpsest and of the ixth cent. The original description of this manuscript by William Wright includes characters, symbols, or illustrations which cannot be represented. Please consult the attached image.

handNote.desc: The older portions of this volume, foll. 1—15 and 47—87, are written in a fine, regular Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

item.p: On the margin of fol. 48 a, one Barsauma has recorded his name.

p.quote: ܨ̇ܠܐ ܐܚܘܢ ܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܗܒܗ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܘܥܠ ܡܚܠܘܬ ܕܝܠܝ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܘܥܠ ܐܒܗ̈ܝ.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: On the Dead
msItem.explicit: ܐܦܢܢܝ ܕܐ̇ܦܢܐ ܠܝܕܥܬܟ̇ ܘܐܛܦܣ ܒܟ ܘܐܬܚܣܐ ܒܟ

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: On the blessed Virgin
msItem.incipit: ܠܐܬܪܐ ܕܓܢܝܙ ܡܢ ܥܝܪ̈ܐ. ܩ̇ܪܝܗܝ ܐܠܗܐ ܠܓܒܪܝܐܝܠ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Lament of the Poor Man
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܪܘܥܡܗ ܕܡܣܟܢܐ. ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 320, no. 116.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Nativity of our Lord

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: A homily on repentance by Ephraim
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܪܓܡܐ ܕܥܠ ܬܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܡܠܦܢܐ
msItem.explicit: ܩܠܝܠ ܗ̣ܘ ܚ̈ܝܐ ܫܪ̈ܟܘ ܠܟ ܡܢ ܣ̈ܓܝܐܐ. ܠܐ ܬܪܦܐ ܢܦܩ̈ܝܢ ܒܝܫ ܒܝܫ. ܐܝܟ ܕܢܦܩܘ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܩܕܡ̈ܝܗܘܢ.

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: On the rich man and his gold
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܕܥܠ ܥܬܝܪܐ ܘܥܠ ܕܗܒܗ

item.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/2. The quires, signed with letters and arithmetical figures must have been at least 15 in number; but several of them are lost, and others are imperfect, leaves being wanting after foll. 21 and 30. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 20 to 35 lines. These leaves are palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of three older volumes (see Add. 17,164, foll. 16, 27, and 38, lower text , Add. 17,164, foll. 17-19, 21-26, 28-33, 35-37, 39-46, lower text , and Add. 17,164, foll. 20 and 34, lower text ).

handNote.desc: These leaves are written in an inelegant Estrangela of the ixth cent.

handNote.desc: These leaves are written in a fine Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

msItem.author: John Chrysostom
msItem.title: The homilies of John Chrysostom on the epistle to the Romans

rubric.fw: ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ ܕܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܪ̈ܗܘܡܝܐ. ܕܚܣܝܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܦܘܠܝܣ.

msItem.note: The running title is distinctly legible in several places. On fol. 45a we find the commencement of hom. xxxii.

item.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/2, written in double columns. These leaves are palimpsest (see Add. 17,164, foll. 16-46, upper text ).

handNote.desc: The leaves are written in a small, elegant character of the vith or viith cent.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
